author: zorthgo
body:
Hi guys, 

I am trying to use the **System.Management.Automation** nuget package version **7.0.0-preview.4** in my application. But I keep getting the error message below when I try to run it. 

**Error Message:**
```none
Cannot load PowerShell snap-in Microsoft.PowerShell.Diagnostics because of the following error: Could not load file or assembly 'C:\Users\MyUser\Source\Repos\ConsoleApp2\ConsoleApp2\bin\Debug\netcoreapp3.0\Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands'. The system cannot find the file specified
```

**Screenshot:**
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14120863/67114942-0eb5ae00-f1ab-11e9-9a5a-8d2eacc329db.png)


The PowerShell version installed on my computer is: 5.1.14393.2879
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14120863/67114335-af0ad300-f1a9-11e9-817f-d627c124fccc.png)


# Steps to reproduce

1. Install the System.Management.Automation nuget package version 7.0.0-preview.4 in a new .Net Core console application. 

2. Update your Main method in the Program class. 
 ```powershell
        static void Main(string[] args)
        {

            PowerShell
                .Create()
                .AddScript("get-process")
                .Invoke();

        }
```

# Expected behavior

```none
Return a list of processes
```

# Actual behavior

```none
Throws an error message.
```

comments.author: zorthgo
comments.body: The fix to this error message is to install the **Microsoft.PowerShell.SDK** package instead of the System.Management.Automation.

title: Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands DLL not found
